title: Worlds Countdown in the client
body: Hi everyone.  Quick heads-up that we'll be launching a countdown to the start of Group Stage in the client landing page today.  You can toggle it off (to return to the Featured Spectate card) by clicking the arrows in the countdown's upper-right corner.  Hit us up with any questions or issues!

replies.body: I don't care much for the timer, but I applaud you guys for _finally_ adding a toggle function to switch back to the Spectate card. I don't frequently spectate matches, but when I do, it seems like there's _always_ something else taking its spot in the client.

I love your name. 
Zerocontext
ha
"Zero context" also happens to be his core philosophy when he comes to me with an idea :)
Brand's burns don't even compare to yours
Hey, whatever works! :-D
Thanks :-D

Thanks for the feedback!  We're really interested to see if players find that toggle to be a useful addition to the Featured Spectate card.

Speaking of Spectate, what are the kinds of games you look for when you do decide to spectate matches?  Games with specific champs?  Specific players?  Just a random match to kill some time?

I almost never use the clients spectate game feature, but when I do I look at the champions. I want to see a champion I play, or a champion that isn't seen as often. To that extent, I feel like featured games which have very similar rosters are a waste of time.

Thanks for the feedback. Are there any specific reasons why you don't use the spectate card typically? Is it because you are usually playing? Or is it because it doesn't provide the kind of experience you're looking for right now? For example, is it hard to find games with champions you play?

I usually choose to spectate a game from the Featured card because I either (1) don't have enough time (or desire) to queue up for a full match, but still want to see some League or (2) want to see a particular champion (usually in a particular role) in action. 

A few other personal notes:

- I like to spectate games from the beginning whenever possible, but don't have the option to do so as much as I would like.

- I'm pretty indifferent to the names of the players in the Featured card because I figure if I want to see a specific pro or player, I can tune into his or her stream.

- I hate accidentally spectating an ARAM game. I know there are some people who like to, but I wish the Featured card allowed me to turn off certain maps or game modes.

- I occasionally want to spectate other levels of play (usually my own), but have no way of doing so.

- I wish I had the ability to spectate a game with certain parameters (e.g. a particular champion in a particular role or combination of champions on a team).

I think it boils down to a few reasons:

* I don't leave my client open (or open my client) unless I'm looking to play a game. 
* The spectate client isn't available everywhere. I can't be on my phone or in my living room spectating a game, I must go to a certain location of my home and watch there.
* I enjoy commentary to go along with my viewing of games. Be it a Twitch Stream, YouTube, or something else. The current spectator doesn't facilitate that.

In the rare moment when I'm sitting down at my computer, the League client is up, I have to wait to play a game with a friend, and I feel like spectating a game all at once, then I often do feel like it comes down to what champions are being played. I don't care to watch a game with all champions in the top 5% pick rate, I see enough of those champions in my own games.

**TL;DR: The spectate feature doesn't provide the kind of experience I'm most looking for**.

What I'd like from the spectator client would be some sort of mash-up between Twitch and the Spectator Client. 

* Audio from commentator's coming through, tied to the game timeline, with a checkbox to turn it off or leave it on.
* Option to follow the commentator's camera. Lets be honest, the people following the LCS action are way, *way* better at knowing where to keep things focused than the automatic camera is.
* Audio from a specific player. This would have to be an opt-in, turn-on type thing, but could be a great alternative to Twitch streaming
* Option to follow a specific player's camera/mouse (basically first person view, see how they set up for things, where they're looking, etc.)
* A way to easily see if a player is in game and spectate their game, ideally launching from a web browser. If they're not on my friends list, I've got no idea if they're playing a game or not, and it makes it harder to spectate them.

I realize this is a pretty far fetched dream, but I think a lot of people would actually want something like this. Can you imagine being able to go and look at a play from Worlds, go back and watch the play unfold from any perspective you wanted? Maybe you were really interested in what the support was doing on the back line, but the cameraman focused on the assassin going in 1v3. Currently you can't do anything about that but home there's a second clip, but with this type of a system you could.
For me it's the external program part. I have select a game in the client, go through a loading screen and only then can I spectate. When I want to watch some League on the fly I start my browser.

It's great if you just want to watch high elo games, but they're all the same shit that we see every day from Streamers. I feel like when people want to watch high elo games, they would just turn on WingsofDeath or Dyrone, not go to the Spectatable Games. Make them something interesting, or at least have more of a variety. I want to watch the depths of bronze V trip over each other. I want to watch the imported Korean Zed main dump on Silvers. Just something interesting. I feel like most people don't use it because streamers just do the same thing with commentary and twitch chat memes.

>
> Thanks for the feedback!  We're really interested to see if players find that toggle to be a useful addition to the Featured Spectate card.
> 
> Speaking of Spectate, what are the kinds of games you look for when you do decide to spectate matches?  Games with specific champs?  Specific players?  Just a random match to kill some time?

Mostly I look for interesting champions or combos
(like {{champion:34}}/{{champion:59}}/{{champion:48}} + {{champion:67}}/{{champion:78}}/{{champion:150}}
or {{champion:69}} + {{champion:17}}/{{champion:27}}/{{champion:29}})
played in high elo ranked. (Don't really get why aram or...anything but ranked shows up on spectate, I just get annoyed if I accidentally click to watch a game without noticing it's not ranked, or at least high elo 5v5 normals....but..that's just me..)

And more specifically than that, I look for new champs..or champs that have been recently changed significantly (buffed, nerfed, skill(s) remade. Are they OP now, are they still viable? just *how much* did the buff/nerf change their play..?)

Or sometimes just ones that make me go 'huh?' like some weird combo of karth+anivia+annie all on the same team, I think to myself, 'How are they going to make that work?' and watch and see.

(Actually something like that was how I found out Karthus ~~is~~ was a viable jungler.)

For me at least, players are the core focus of matches I spectate. It's part of the reason streaming services like twitch get so many people watching streams. 

On a similar note, most LCS matches are based on the meta and a lot of the spectate matches are outside that meta. Would be cool if you could make a distinction, as I always find it interesting to observe "break the meta" instances so to speak.
Cool. That's an interesting suggestion we don't hear often!

Would be cool to see some Twisted Treeline & Crystal Scar matches being available in the spectate card. Leave the majority as SR ranked, but add a TT ranked, CS normal and HA normal along with what's already there.

I know this is slightly off topic. But while on an interface related subject - would you happen to know if the store/matchmaking etc. will receive any kind of UI update in the pre-season to match the rest of the client graphical improvements?

I am pretty sure Riot is working on an entirely new client because the current is simply too old to work with.
I'm not techie though.

Alas, those features are out of my area so I don't have any useful info to share.  Although I can say that we (meaning Rito) are working hard to keep players more informed about what's going on and about our priorities regarding what's coming up, so as those specific teams have things to start talking about, you should expect them to be super forthcoming.  Sorry about the non-answer answer :-/

>Speaking of Spectate, what are the kinds of games you look for when you do decide to spectate matches? Games with specific champs? Specific players? Just a random match to kill some time?

Maybe random cycling games that we have now with an added filter option to look for games with certain champions or matches within a certain elo range.  Probably can't be easily done with this client, but maybe an idea for a new version.  

Either way, it would be nice to not see pro scene content plastered over every square inch of the home page for a change.  Not everyone enjoys it as much as Riot apparently does and would like to focus on the rest of the community if we had the option to toggle the advertisements on or off.

Good feedback -- thanks.  To your second point, we're exploring ways to help connect players with the content that's most relevant to them (and avoid the content that's not!)  The more you can share with us which content and in-client experiences you care about and find most useful/interesting, the better. :-)

Something else I thought I should add is the ability to voice chat with friends in the client.  It might be a cool idea to have the ability to open voice coms with people on your friends list while in the same lobby.  Note that this shouldn't extend to every lobby filled with strangers because not only would it make toxicity that much harder to track, not everyone wants to talk with randoms every match.

I don't know, just pulling random thoughts.

>The more you can share with us which content and in-client experiences you care about and find most useful/interesting, the better. :-)

I'm not sure exactly what you're looking for with in-client experiences, but I thought of something a while ago that could be interesting,  This is my copypasta from a thread asking for something to do with our IP:
----
How about something purely client based that doesn't add an advantage like old splash arts? Personally, I've hated the new Ahri splash since they forced it through despite community feedback, and would appreciate the option to buy the old splash art to use in my client so when Teambuilder eats my skin, I can still see the old splash, or on the HUD or on the minimap I can see the image on the Insert Champion Icon button.

If people don't like the new splash arts, or even the new voices when they get a VU, we should have the ability to buy their old splashes and voices to use on our clients with IP.

This could also extend to things like buying back the old HUD if we don't like the new one, or enable us to buy announcer packs in addition to the old HUD. It doesn't disrupt anything for people playing with and against each other. They'll see and hear what their client is set to present.

---


Among those, I remember seeing something about custom interfaces with faction themed additions such as an Ionian-looking HUD kind of like how Howling Abyss has a HUD with an icy touch to it.  Once again, this will all be personal and would give no advantages to the player while also giving us something to do with our extraordinary amounts of IP we've accumulated with nothing to spend it on.
You're no longer doing that thing where the entire front page is taken up by esports stuff. Good. Continue doing that.
(I moved this post. The mobile client posted my reply in the wrong spot.)

Really like this.  Would like to see an option in-client for LCS games that happen throughout the season that could be in the place of the spectate mode (not just worlds - kind of like an ESPN-ish ticker and update of how teams and regions are doing).
